Encryption Key Rotation
All Snowflake-managed keys are automatically rotated by Snowflake when they are more than 30 days old.

questions.question_text: Which user object property requires contacting Snowflake Support in order to set a value for it?

discussion.content:
correct answer C
It is possible to temporarily bypass a network policy for a set number of minutes by configuring the user object property MINS_TO_BYPASS_NETWORK_POLICY, which can be viewed by executing DESCRIBE USER. Only Snowflake can set the value for this object property. Please contact Snowflake Support to set a value for this property.

Selected Answer: C
correct

Selected Answer: C
C
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/sql/desc-user

Selected Answer: C
Correct

questions.question_text: How does Snowflake handle the bulk unloading of data into single or multiple files?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
from doc:
Bulk Unloading into Single or Multiple Files
The COPY INTO <location> command provides a copy option (SINGLE) for unloading data into a single file or multiple files. The default is SINGLE = FALSE (i.e. unload into multiple files).

Snowflake assigns each file a unique name. The location path specified for the command can contain a filename prefix that is assigned to all the data files generated. If a prefix is not specified, Snowflake prefixes the generated filenames with data_.

Selected Answer: C
Q: .. into single OR multiple files?
A: .. default option is SINGLE = TRUE.

comments.content:
ANS = A... default is SINGLE = False.
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/data-unload-overview

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/data-unload-overview#bulk-unloading-into-single-or-multiple-files

Selected Answer: A
Not C because DEFAULT for SINGLE is FALSE
Not D
Not B
Leaves A only 
"However, when an unload operation writes multiple files to a stage, Snowflake appends a suffix that ensures each file name is unique across parallel execution threads"
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/sql/copy-into-location

Selected Answer: D
Snowflake uses the COPY INTO Statement for bulk unload into single or Multiple files. By default SINGLE = FALSE

Selected Answer: C
single or multiple files : C is correct for single

Selected Answer: A
COPY command is used to load the Table data into a file which is sure. Whether its Single File or Multiple Filed is decided by SINGLE option being True or False. Option C says, Copy command is used to unload the file which is correct. but the Default value of Single is FALSE. not TRUE. So, the only option is A.

Selected Answer: A
correct

Selected Answer: A
Snowflake assigns each file a unique name. The location path specified for the command can contain a filename prefix that is assigned to all the data files generated. If a prefix is not specified, Snowflake prefixes the generated filenames with data_.

discussion.content:

Bulk Unloading into Single or Multiple Files
The COPY INTO <location> command provides a copy option (SINGLE) for unloading data into a single file or multiple files. The default is SINGLE = FALSE (i.e. unload into multiple files).

choices.C: It uses COPY INTO [location] for bulk unloading where the default option is SINGLE = TRUE.
choices.A: It assigns each unloaded data file a unique name.
choices.B: It uses the PUT command to download the data by default.
choices.D: It uses COPY INTO [location] to copy the data from a table into one or more files in an external stage only.

choices.E: Graphical representation of the query processing plan
choices.D: Details and statistics for the overall query

questions.question_text: Query results are stored in the Result Cache for how long after they are last accessed, assuming no data changes have occurred?
